action.action-desc: Mr. Case (for himself and Mr. Moylan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 46, United States Code, to exempt certain noncontiguous trade from the coastwise laws.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Noncontiguous Shipping Competition Act.

section.header: Shipping: Exemption of certain noncontiguous trade from the coastwise laws
section.text: Section 55101(b) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking or after the semicolon;
in paragraph (3), by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
carriage on a route in noncontiguous trade (as that term is defined in section 53501), unless—

subparagraph.text: at least three owners or operators of coastwise qualified vessels (as that term is defined in section 55108(a)) regularly operate such a vessel on such route;
each of such owners or operators transports at least 20 percent of the volume of goods on that route; and
none of such owners or operators are under common ownership.
